metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15996 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
elfcomm.c in readelf in GNU Binutils 2.29 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (excessive memory allocation) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted ELF file that triggers a "bufferoverflow on fuzzed archive header," related to an uninitialized variable,an improper conditional jump, and the get_archive_member_name,process_archive_index_and_symbols, and setup_archive functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15996` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1').
